item.title: Cheating
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

“However, if you or your client use my site, you are breaking the contract anyone must agree to in order to use my site”

How many times does it have to be repeated that this does not hold, you cannot stop Jagex coming here, there is no legal weight behind that sentence :roll:

Read full topic

sanga282:

Just read those logs Mopar, and it sounds like to me that iof they managed to get those lniks they must have been on the site at one point or another

item.title: Cheating
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Imo, I think they look for totally different accounts that do the same thing as other accounts, which could possibly mean they’re using the same scripts… I use RSBot now, I used to use Scar. I’ve never received a ban for macroing. When I begin using a new script, I change wait times, coords, break times, all stuff that can change depending on the user, so it makes my account look unique.

I also don’t bot 10 hours a day like some of the tards here do, I do a max of 3-4 a day.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheating
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:38, topic:283276”][quote author=bowserjr2 link=topic=374331.msg2826711#msg2826711 date=1245070684]

We have known (not conclusively, but it makes sense) that they have been downloading and checking out our cheats to see what they are doing that is detectable. They actually admitted it here though, which is kind of neat. (and against my TOS, lawsuit anyone?)

I doubt your TOS is legally binding.

The whole point of my TOS is that it is as least as legally binding as Jagex’s TOS. They threaten to sue upon breaches of it, so I can do the same.

Theres a simple way to test this, if you get a good rumour started about the latest in botting technology is here they will want to come and test it and see what it does and how it works, even if its just a bot that isnt anything new they will still check. When they do you know conclusively that they have taken this from your site.

How do I know if ‘they’ are checking or not? I know they have been here from back in the day when I got a registered letter from their lawyers, which is why I put up the TOS in the first place.

What did they write to you?
And are you doing something illegal?
[/quote]

Here is all of my correspondence between Jagex (and their lawyers) and I:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/lawstuff

It all happened in late 2006, early 2007, they have not contacted me since.[/quote]
The last lines in that log were funny.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheating
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:39, topic:283276”]Just wait till mechscape servers moparisthebest.

Whole new chapter.[/quote]

Same stuff still applies though.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheating
item.dc:creator: @Andrew Andrew
item.description:
@Andrew wrote:

eczema3:

Of course they’re bluffing, Jagex don’t do anything about anyone unless you actually get reported, and when you get reported, it can be for any reason, Jagex checks all their logs and all the things that you’ve been up to on rs. I had botted pure ess for ~1 week straight and then about 2 weeks after someone reported me for Offensive language and I get banned for macroning.

Wrong. Jagex doesn’t just look for people who have been reported, but abnormal things such as getting stuck in a random for 1+ hours.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheating
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I got an email from adelx solicitors ages ago for radeon-oliver.be and again for aresbot.com, they dont follow it up. it is a template email. to try and scare you.

Read full topic

Theres a simple way to test this, if you get a good rumour started about the latest in botting technology is here they will want to come and test it and see what it does and how it works, even if its just a bot that isnt anything new they will still check. When they do you know conclusively that they have taken this from your site.

How do I know if ‘they’ are checking or not? I know they have been here from back in the day when I got a registered letter from their lawyers, which is why I put up the TOS in the first place.

What did they write to you?
And are you doing something illegal?[/quote]
Probably their standard DMCA: “It has come to our attention that [insertyoursitehere] contains content that is in violation of the Digital Millennium Act [insertsectionhere]. You have [insertnumberhere] days to remove the content before we will take legal action.”
